intro: Sacciolepis polymorpha var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf sacciolepis, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean. It is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to saline and wind-prone environments. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is known for its ornamental value. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
